If Not Then Don’t Forget To Check This Kolkata Ever Thought Of Beaches Near Kolkata? If Not Then Don’t Forget To Check This June 4, 2025 320 8 minutes read Image by Times of India Kolkata, the capital of West Bengal, is a vibrant city with a rich cultural heritage. It is also the gateway to some of the most beautiful beaches in India. From bustling sea beaches to serene offbeat stretches, Kolkata has it all. In this blog, we will explore some of the best beaches near Kolkata that you can visit for a quick getaway. Table of Contents Toggle Top Beaches Near Kolkata1. Mandarmani Beach2. Digha Beach3. Sagar Beach4. Bakkhali Beach5. Tajpur Beach6. Talasari Beach7. Chandipur BeachConclusion Top Beaches Near Kolkata 1. Mandarmani Beach Located about 180 km from Kolkata, Mandarmani is a popular sea beach destination. It is the longest drive-in beach in India, where you can take a leisurely drive along the 13 km long beach road. The beach is lined with rows of casuarinas trees, providing a picturesque view. The water is shallow and the beach is relatively clean, making it perfect for swimming and sunbathing. Image by westbengaltourism.com Things to do – There are several activities that you can indulge in at Mandarmani. Take a leisurely stroll along the beach and enjoy the fresh sea breeze. You can also try your hand at various water sports such as jet skiing and parasailing. If you are feeling adventurous, you can go on a boat ride to explore the mangroves in the area. Digha Beach Digha is one of the sea beaches near kolkata, located about 190 km from the city. It is one of the most popular beach destinations in West Bengal and attracts a large number of tourists every year. The beach stretches for about 8 km and is dotted with rows of casuarinas trees. The water is shallow and the sand is clean, making it ideal for swimming and sunbathing. Image by kolkatatourism.com Things to do – You can take a stroll along the beach and enjoy the sea breeze. There are also several water sports activities that you can try, such as jet skiing and parasailing. If you are interested in marine life, you can visit the Marine Aquarium and Regional Centre, which is home to a variety of marine species. Where to Stay: Hotels Near Digha Beach Kolkata 3. Sagar Beach Sagar Beach is located about 225 km from Kolkata and is a popular destination for weekend getaways. The beach stretches for about 5 km and is dotted with rows of casuarinas trees. The water is shallow and the sand is clean, making it ideal for swimming and sunbathing. This is one of the less popular yet amazingly beautiful beaches near kolkata. Image by beachesofindia.com Things to do – Visitors can enjoy a variety of activities at the beach, including swimming and sunbathing on the white sands, and trying out water sports such as boating and fishing. The beach is also home to a number of charming shacks, where you can grab a bite to eat or enjoy a refreshing drink. In addition to the beach, there are also a number of temples and historical sites located in the surrounding area, which are worth exploring.  Nature lovers, Check out 10 Exotic hill stations near Kolkata. 4. Bakkhali Beach Bakkhali is a small sea beach town located about 130 km from Kolkata.  Which will be a good places for those looking for offbeat beaches near kolkata. It is known for its serene surroundings and peaceful atmosphere. The beach stretches for about 7 km and is dotted with rows of casuarinas trees. The water is shallow and the sand is clean, making it ideal for swimming and sunbathing. Things to do – The beach is lined with casuarina and palm trees and is ideal for spending a lazy day by the sea. Take a stroll on the beach, enjoy the sunset, and explore the local markets. You can also go for a boat ride in the river and visit the nearby islands. If you are looking for some adventure, you can go for swimming, fishing and bird watching. There are also some great food joints near the beach where you can enjoy some delicious seafood.If you are interested in nature, you can visit Henry’s Island, which is home to a variety of flora and fauna. 5. Tajpur Beach Located just over 200 kilometers from Kolkata, Tajpur Beach is a popular destination for both locals and tourists alike. The beach is known for its pristine white sands and crystal clear waters, which make it a perfect spot for swimming and sunbathing. In addition to lounging on the beach, visitors can also enjoy a variety of water sports, including surfing, parasailing, and jet skiing.  Things to do – You can enjoy a variety of activities here such as swimming, sunbathing, beach volleyball, camping, bird watching, stargazing and much more. You can also explore the nearby villages, go on a boat ride, and visit the local temples. If you’re looking for an adventure, you can try your hand at kite surfing and parasailing. Kolkata nearby beaches have many things in common yet each one is unique. 6. Talasari Beach Located in the district of Purba Medinipur, Talasari Beach is another of the best beaches near Kolkata, 144 kms away from the city. The beach is known for its beautiful stretch of golden sands and turquoise waters, which make it a perfect spot for swimming and sunbathing. In addition to lounging on the beach, visitors can also enjoy a variety of water sports, including boating and fishing. The beach is also home to a number of charming shacks, where you can grab a bite to eat or enjoy a refreshing drink. Things to do – You can spend your day sunbathing on the beach, swimming in the crystal clear waters, and exploring the local villages. Other activities include exploring the nearby mangroves, bird watching, dolphin spotting, and visiting the nearby temple. For an adrenaline rush, you can try watersports such as jet skiing, wind surfing, and parasailing. There are also several restaurants, beach shacks and local markets to explore. Also read, Places to visit near Kolkata in 1 Day. 7. Chandipur Beach Located in the district of Baleswar, Chandipur Beach is a popular destination that you can reach in 6 hours by road from kolkata, distance being 260 kms.The beach is known for its beautiful stretch of golden sands and crystal clear waters, which make it a perfect spot for swimming and sunbathing. In addition to lounging on the beach, visitors can also enjoy a variety of water sports, including boating and fishing. The beach is also home to a number of charming shacks, where you can grab a bite to eat or enjoy a refreshing drink. Imaqge by Times of India Things to do – Chandipur Beach near Kolkata is an ideal spot for a fun-filled vacation. There are plenty of activities to do here, from sunbathing on the beach and swimming in the sea to exploring the nearby attractions. You can also take a stroll along the beach and enjoy the beautiful sight of the sun setting into the horizon. There are plenty of restaurants and shops in the area to enjoy some delicious local cuisine. You can also go for a boat ride to get a closer look at the marine life and the nearby islands. There are also several adventure activities such as parasailing, surfing, and water skiing that you can enjoy. Don’t forget to take a walk along the beach to admire the beautiful landscape and catch a glimpse of the local wildlife. Conclusion Kolkata beaches & beaches nearby are perfect for a quick getaway if you’re looking for an offbeat place to visit. Whether you’re searching for a beach with crystal clear waters and white sands or a more laid-back atmosphere, you’re sure to love the experience. Count-in the gorgeous beaches near Kolkata for an unforgettable holiday!  For accommodation, you can check out Treebo Hotels in Kolkata. A: Yes, in addition to the beach, there are also a number of temples and historical sites located in the surrounding area of Sagar Beach that are worth exploring. Q2: Is it safe to swim at the Sea beaches near Kolkata? A: It is generally safe to swim at the beaches near Kolkata, although it is always important to be cautious and follow any safety guidelines or warnings that may be in place. It is also a good idea to check the current conditions of the beach before swimming. Q3: Is Chandipur Beach suitable for swimming? A: Yes, Chandipur Beach is known for its beautiful stretch of golden sands and crystal clear waters, making it a perfect spot for swimming and sunbathing. Q4: Are there any historical sites or temples near Sagar Beach? A: Yes, there are a number of temples and historical sites located in the surrounding area of Sagar Beach. These are worth exploring for a more cultural experience during your beach holiday. Q5: Can I enjoy water sports at all the beaches near Kolkata? A: Yes, all the beaches mentioned in this blog offer a variety of water sports such as surfing, parasailing, jet skiing, boating, and fishing.
